conclusion: Determine the ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for particles A and B during their deceleration phases.
Particle A decelerates between t = 2t0 and t = 3t0. Particle B decelerates between t = 5t0 and t = 6t0.
Calculate acceleration for Particle A: Initial velocity at t = 2t0 is 2v0, final velocity at t = 3t0 is 0, time interval is t0.
Acceleration a_A is calculated as -2v0/t0, magnitude is 2v0/t0.
Calculate acceleration for Particle B: Initial velocity at t = 5t0 is v0, final velocity at t = 6t0 is 0, time interval is t0.
Acceleration a_B is calculated as -v0/t0, magnitude is v0/t0.
Determine the ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration: |a_A|/|a_B| = 2.
The ratio of the magnitudes of the accelerations for A and B during their deceleration phases is 2.
